title: Game of Thrones prequel:HBO Cancels Naomi Watts-Starrer Game of Thrones Prequel Because It Apparently Didn’t Like The Pilot Episode
text:
HBO Cancels Naomi Watts-Starrer Game of Thrones Prequel Because It Apparently Didn’t Like The Pilot Episode

HBO Cancels Naomi Watts-Starrer Game of Thrones Prequel Because It Apparently Didn’t Like The Pilot Episode

All those who were waiting for Game of Thrones prequels thinking they’ll be like blessing in disguise in the aftermath of the most disappointing finale season, there’s a good news and bad news.

Instagram

The good news is that HBO has confirmed a 10-episode Game of Thrones prequel called House of the Dragon, which will be about the Targaryen civil war.

#HouseOfTheDragon, a #GameofThrones prequel is coming to @HBO.

The series is co-created by @GRRMSpeaking and Ryan Condal. Miguel Sapochnik will partner with Condal as showrunner and will direct the pilot and additional episodes. Condal will be writing the series. pic.twitter.com/9ttMzElgXm — Game of Thrones (@GameOfThrones) October 29, 2019

On the other hand, according to a report on ew.com, a prequel starring Naomi Watts, which was one the ambitious project taking place during Westeros’ Age of Heroes on the precipice of The Long Night war with the White Walkers, has been cancelled after the pilot episode was shot.

Twitter

Don't Miss 1 K SHARES 9.7 K SHARES 42 K SHARES 6.4 K SHARES 21.3 K SHARES

HBO reportedly had only ordered only the pilot episode for the series. After it was shot, it is said, HBO didn’t quite like it, and so it cancelled the entire series.

Twitter

For the unversed, it is said that the original Game of Thrones series was also disastrous. However, there were some elements that HBO thought had potential. And so, it decided to order the series anyway.

Twitter

Now that the series which was supposed to be about the Starks and Lannisters has been cancelled, people have mixed feelings.

Game of Thrones prequel cancelled. Is this the end for GoT? I haven't watched the final season, but I was still really excited for a White Walker prequel. pic.twitter.com/q4hJdBYwK1 — Jake Voorhees 💀 (@JakeWocky) October 29, 2019

So the Stark prequel got cancelled and the Targaryen prequel is in order!

The north will be remembered 😭#GameOfThrones #HouseOfTheDragon pic.twitter.com/mds2I9fZvK — Bablu Chocobar (@ChocobarBablu) October 30, 2019

Not only #GameOfThrones fell from grace faster than my wildest dreams could have predicted, #DnD are being exposed for the hacks they are, they lost their Star Wars movie, and the Long Night prequel is cancelled.

There's only one feeling now: pic.twitter.com/Qby9n69yRX — Priscilla Zorzi (@Priscilla_Zorzi) October 29, 2019

David Benioff and DB Weiss are no longer making a Star Wars Trilogy and the Game of Thrones prequel series has been cancelled 🔥🔥🔥

Anyone got more good news? — Bentally ill (@NoticeMeBenpaii) October 29, 2019

Saving #GameOfThrones from further shame. Good thing they cancelled it the prequel — Ammar (@ammar__mani) October 29, 2019

Oh. The Game of Thrones prequel got cancelled...

I guess that's a good thing

Looks like the Targaryen-centric one will still maybe happen though — MAY (@4CRIMSON_CLOVER) October 30, 2019

So the @GameOfThrones prequel is cancelled? After the pilot was filmed? How bad was it? And will we ever get to see it?! — TheGeekyTate (@GeekyTate) October 30, 2019

Oh. The Game of Thrones prequel got cancelled...

I guess that's a good thing

Looks like the Targaryen-centric one will still maybe happen though — MAY (@4CRIMSON_CLOVER) October 30, 2019

The cancelled Game of Thrones prequel about the Age of Heroes isn't even that much of a loss. It would've been about the Long Night, the Starks and the White Walkers, and we literally just had all that in GoT. The Targaryen Conquest is much more interesting. #HouseOfTheDragon — Matt-o'-lantern 🎃 (@matthewjmartin_) October 30, 2019

What was the series about? The official synopsis read, “The series chronicles the world’s descent from the golden Age of Heroes into its darkest hour. And only one thing is for sure: from the horrifying secrets of Westeros’ history to the true origin of the white walkers, the mysteries of the East to the Starks of legend… it’s not the story we think we know.”

Do you think HBO took the right decision? Tell us about it in the comment section below.
description: All those who were waiting for Game of Thrones prequels thinking they’ll be like blessing in disguise in the aftermath of the most disappointing finale season, there’s a good news and a bad news. The good news is that HBO has confirmed a 10-episode Game of Thrones prequel called House of the Dragon, which will be about the Targaryen civil war.
